com.github.powerlibraries.io

Interface In

    • Method Detail

      • file

        static InBuilder file(java.lang.String file)
        This creates an input of any kind from a File. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build.
        Parameters:
        file - the path to read from
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • file

        static InBuilder file(java.io.File file)
        This creates an input of any kind from a File. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to read from
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • resource

        static InBuilder resource(java.net.URL resource)
        This creates an input of any kind from an URL. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource URL to read from
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • resource

        static InBuilder resource(java.lang.Class<?> referenceClass,
                          java.lang.String resourceName)
        This creates an input of any kind from an URL. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build. This call is the same as calling: 
         In.resource(referenceClass.getResource(resourceName));
        Parameters:
        referenceClass - the class used to resolve the resourceName
        resourceName - the name of resource to load (see Class.getResource(java.lang.String))
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • resource

        static InBuilder resource(java.lang.String resourceName)
        This creates an input of any kind from an URL. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build. This call is the same as calling: 
         In.resource(In.class.getResource(resourceName));
        Parameters:
        resourceName - the name of resource to load (see Class.getResource(java.lang.String))
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • stream

        static InBuilder stream(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
        This creates an input of any kind from an InputStream. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build. Be aware that if you use this method you can only build one Input with the Builder. Otherwise the given stream will be used more than once.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the InputStream to read from
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • string

        static InBuilder string(java.lang.String str)
        This creates an input of any kind from a String. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build. This method uses the default Charset
        Parameters:
        str - the String to read from
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • string

        static InBuilder string(java.lang.String str,
                        java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        This creates an input of any kind from a String. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to read from
        charset - the Charset that should be used to decode the string into bytes
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • source

        static InBuilder source(Source source)
        This creates an input of any kind from a Source. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build. This method can be used with custom implementations of the Source interface.
        Parameters:
        source - the Source to read from
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • bytes

        static InBuilder bytes(byte[] bytes)
        This creates an input of any kind from an array of bytes. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array to read from
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created

      • bytes

        static InBuilder bytes(byte[] bytes,
                       int offset,
                       int length)
        This creates an input of any kind from an array of bytes. The returned InBuilder can be used to specifiy which kind of Reader or InputStream should be created and allows you to specify further how the input chain is build.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array to read from
        offset - the offset in the buffer of the first byte to read
        length - the maximum number of bytes to read from the buffer.
        Returns:
        an InBuilder used to specify which kind of input should be created
